cyclone.name: MATTHEW
cyclone.current_location: about 125 miles SE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continues north-northwest hugging the southeast U.S. coastline, passing very near the Florida east coast Friday, the Georgia coast early Saturday, then brushing the South Carolina coast and curving eastward just offshore of North Carolina by Sunday.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the South Carolina coast (around Charleston/Myrtle Beach area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Englewood to Anclote River, FL (tropical-storm watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: North of South Santee River, SC to Surf City, NC (tropical-storm warning); Boca Raton, FL to South Santee River, SC (hurricane warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast U.S. coastline from Florida east coast through North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely with a small chance of hurricane-force gusts as the center passes offshore.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation possible along the Cape Fear River and adjacent coastal sections near Wilmington.
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches, locally up to 15 inches along the immediate coast, causing flash flooding concerns.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and a low risk of isolated tornadoes in outer rain bands.
